remarks: Solutions to the depressed cubic, a special case of ~ cubic .  (The definitions of ` M , N , G , T ` here differ from ~ mcubic by scale factors of ` -u 9 ` , ` 5 4 ` , ` 5 4 ` and ` -u 2 7 ` respectively, to simplify the algebra and presentation.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.)

dcubic.n $e |- ( ph -> N = ( Q / 2 ) ) $.
dcubic.0 $e |- ( ph -> T =/= 0 ) $.
dcubic $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ( X ^ 3 ) + ( ( P x. X ) + Q ) ) = 0 <-> E. r e. CC ( ( r ^ 3 ) = 1 /\ X = ( ( r x. T ) - ( M / ( r x. T ) ) ) ) ) ) $.
